body: Your test should be added through jenkins file. Find the fastest workload and group, add your new case there. And make sure test passed.

Thanks @innerpeacez. some nits here:
1. we should consider adding "timeout" to all status wait. if deployments don't work in a particular duration, the task should be marked as failed.
1. add "set -e" in your scripts, if there's some error, scripts will stop there.
After that, please add `rabbitmq-scenario` task into the Jenkinsfile.

@zhaoyuguang Is this version supposed?

@czq080 Have you checked the supported list document?
@czq080 Document said, `Redisson Easy Java Redis client 3.5.2+`. Do you use the easy Java Redis client?
@wu-sheng yes.

hi @czq080  Please provide the demo, let us reproduce this case.
And use `dependency:tree` find the real redisson version

Repo created, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-cli
All committers should have access rights soon automatically.
redisson-scenario for me

Skywalking6.4 is compatible with redisson3.11.0
Change your redisson to redisson3.11.0

> I have the same problem
> Skywalking6.4 is compatible with redisson3.11.0
> Change your redisson to redisson3.11.0

Got it.
Could we make it in the configuration and 10k as default?
ES 6 is recommendation storage today.
Thank you for your reply. What is the current way to support elastic search 7. X，Production environment currently working es 7
You need to implement storage by yourself.
at present, is there any other way to choose besides supporting es and H2 data storage?
MySQL or TiDB.
Read the compiling doc. It is there.

There are configs there
```yaml
flushInterval: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_FLUSH_INTERVAL:10} # flush the bulk every 10 seconds whatever the number of requests
bulkActions: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_BULK_ACTIONS:1000} # Execute the bulk every 1000 requests
concurrentRequests: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_CONCURRENT_REQUESTS:2} # the number of concurrent requests
```
You need to explain your PR, it is hard to explain.
@viswaramamoorthy The PR is under review, please follow the comments there.
/run agent-plugin-test-2
A tool make sense to me. If you want to move it into Apache codebase, let's discuss it how in another thread in mail list. You could propose how to use and how to host in ASF.

> * Should notify through mail list about changelog for this release
> * Why every first letter of the word is upper case? It is unusual in English.

2. I just use the `strings.Title(string)` function in Golang to format the pull request title, does it make sense? I think the words in a title are capitalized in English

> A tool make sense to me. If you want to move it into Apache codebase, let's discuss it how in another thread in mail list. You could propose how to use and how to host in ASF.

Will raise a discussion after I polish the tool
I remember changelog is in normal sentence case, from my understanding.
@dmsolr @wu-sheng I have answered why we should make changes to core api. once you review and get back, i can make changes to test case suggestions to get ready for final merge. let me know

> build a OAP image locally, pick up commit id as the tag.

Pick up jenkins job id should make more sense.

> ES will deploy several pods with the current Helm chart. That's not accepted in CI. So I suggest creating a new ES template which is only enabled in CI.

Agree, we should reduce the unnecessary resource cost.

> we don't deploy UI in CI. So we should write some scripts to fetch data through GraphQL.

Recent e2e has coding to verify by GraphQL, please read codes there.
Where is the minikube deployed?

> Where is the minikube deployed?

It should be installed by scripts locally on VM or should be used inside on a docker image. Which is possible?
@dmsolr There are many Jenkins files

Yes. I will fetch a appropriate minikube version, then set some system
settings to bootstrap it.

I had tested this PR. The issue mentioned before has resolved, but the CPU usage rate is more than our own implementation.
@dmsolr He is running cherry pick test on old release, 6GA. The CPU usage is only a reference. I will try to do a comparison test between this and his, which is using blocking queue.
I mean about specifying the index refresh interval when creating es indexes, as in the code ![](http://cdn.julanling.com/2019/11/FkMvk3lbwfcr8Y5m7tSo3TuD_S1X.png)

@zhaoyuguang That PR merged, please update.

> @zhaoyuguang That PR merged, please update.

OK

@wu-sheng Has this task been added to the 6.5. X milestone? The existing schemes are to modify TraceSegment.java, add tag storage, and store tag to traceid at the same level. Does the working group have a better plan?
No, this is not a feature to be added.
You could submit contributions to this.
@wu-sheng As a skywalking developer, do you have any good suggestions on how to implement this function?
If you want, could extend an index to save the tags and trace id, then query that index first and get all traces based on the results.

You should have witness classes for different version libs.

Also, shardingsphere test case should be moved. @tristaZero are you going to do this?
That is your server error. The header begins being supported since 0.11 Kafka server.
add SupplierWrapper to support java 1.8+ CompletableFuture.supplyAsync #3776

1. Use description rather than issue NO. as title
1. You are facing compiling errors. Please fix it.
resolve https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/3762
This interceptor is for client management, right? So, even using reflect should not cause a performance concern. Am I right?

> This interceptor is for client management, right? So, even using reflect should not cause a performance concern. Am I right?

Yes.
Workload 2 has over 200 cases, and group1 is full I think. Later, group2 should have available slots, and workload 1.

> Don't know why we do not support copy all optional plugins

Because it will become an unstable factor when the new optional plugin added in.

Hi, [ExpectedData.yaml](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/test/plugin/scenarios/apm-toolkit-trace-scenario/config/expectedData.yaml) is not updated. @sxzaihua

> This case didn't include the old Runnable and Callable from last time I checked. Those should be added too.

The case has covered CallableWrapper and RunnableWrapper.
@dmsolr Which workload and group should be added? Or should we start workload 4 for now? @kezhenxu94
@kuaikuai Welcome to be 171st contributor
Why are you sending data to SkyWalking directly, rather than using the agent?
no ,  I  try it by my php framework, because the php extension is not suitable

If you are writing your own client, you need to understand the protocols and processes of all segment, register and ping services, even including the backend logic. This is a very long list. I highly recommend you to work with our php agent subproject team, enhance the feature there, rather than begin from day one.
@wu-sheng  How can I contact  the php agent subproject team ?
Submit an issue at their project, https://github.com/SkyAPM/SkyAPM-php-sdk. I think they will be there.

@wu-sheng 
 I know it,But I don't think this project is suitable for my scenario， I have built a whole microservice system with my framework, and the tracking data has been sent to Jaeger,  but I regret that  jaeger is not good at performance analysis,   Now I just want to modify the framework and send the trace data to  skywalking

Yes, `spring-web` class: `HttpComponentsClientHttpRequestFactory` code
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10150229/68174426-0a65ff00-ffb9-11e9-9cac-aa028aaa876c.png)
Such code can generate the classloader lock first, and then get `ReentrantLock INSTANCE_LOAD_LOCK`?
The plugin test framework doc is ready, #3786. Please take a look
Why? You wrote a framework, then, write a private plugin should be enough, why do the whole thing again?

Don't you think it has deviated from the point ? 
 A private plugin should be enough, so  I am codeing  it,  and the API document are not detailed enough
zookeeper-scenario & lettuce-scenario for me
Lack of the document(if it is), is still a thing about enhancing upstream.  In most cases, I would only recommend working with the upstream team. Don't create the same thing from line one.

Could you try this?
Move
> inst = Class.forName(className, true, pluginLoader).newInstance();

out of lock control, it should work.

Like this?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10150229/68189650-bffb7700-ffe6-11e9-9cf0-89f8d8a9e447.png)
Yes. Because now you have unlocked and the agent class loader has been initialized, if the case is like your post, this should be good.
Thanks, I will try.
LGTM
I'll do this after 4.0.0-RC3 released.
